item.title: Ride: Hooky at Stevens
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: It had been a long four-day week of extended days; there had been a lot of snow; I intended to catch some sleep and do some hours from home. But reality prevailed and I swapped a Friday for some weekend work, and although all my compadres woosed out I headed to Stevens Pass for a … Continue reading "Ride: Hooky at Stevens"
item.content:encoded:
It had been a long four-day week of extended days; there had been a lot of snow; I intended to catch some sleep and do some hours from home. But reality prevailed and I swapped a Friday for some weekend work, and although all my compadres woosed out I headed to Stevens Pass for a brief snowboarding interlude before parenting arrives.

It was a grand day. I’m not big into snowboarding by myself but it was nice, the snow was pretty good (it’s the 1st of December FCOL) with a good bed, some nice fluffy and flurries during the day. Many trees and granite rocks were in evidence. I still have to build up the courage to go down to the basement and check the board for scrapes. There were a few ungroomed runs which let me play a little, and the groomers were fast. As I was myself I only played with the trees a little, and didn’t wear my helmet to remind me not to be silly. As it was a Friday/weekday it was empty, once I had to wait in line for 30 seconds for a chair. Indeed the only downside to going on Friday rather than Saturday was that I hit the 520 rush hour traffic on the way back to Seattle which put a drag on the day, but if I had stopped for food that wouldn’t have happened.

As as I was riding by myself I indulged myself by listening to music all day as there was no one to be social with. I used my iPod Shuffle (old style) with a random collection flung on after breakfast. It was pretty good, and I learned that music can be influential while snowboarding and riding the lifts – *inspirational* (Bitter Sweet Symphony, Verve), *motivating* (Vertigo, U2) and downright *dangerous* (I’m Your Villain, Franz Ferdinand).

It would be nice to do more snowboarding this season, but I’m grateful to get out even once, as Noodlehead will soon be here. And then the fun begins.

—-

Amazon links above will benefit Ballard Corners Park – remember to buy from Amazon from http://ballardcornerspark.org/shop in order to provide funding to the park.

item.title: 1st Dec 06: Not Groomed
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: 1st Dec 06: Not Groomed, originally uploaded by machaggis. From Stevens Pass. It’s now the last month of aphotoperday, my 2006 experiment for carrying a camera and taking a photo every day. Danika has just reflected on how hard it was to blog everyday for a month, and it’s reminded me how challenging this project … Continue reading "1st Dec 06: Not Groomed"
item.content:encoded:
1st Dec 06: Not Groomed, originally uploaded by machaggis.

From Stevens Pass.
It’s now the last month of aphotoperday, my 2006 experiment for carrying a camera and taking a photo every day.
Danika has just reflected on how hard it was to blog everyday for a month, and it’s reminded me how challenging this project is too. I’ve technically missed a couple of days, but have always had an “early a.m. the next day” shot to compensate. And everyone has suffered “completion shot” syndrome such as the books and the signs series. Live it up.
{X50, as taken}

item.title: 16th Apr 06: Love the snow
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: 16th Apr 06: Love the snow, originally uploaded by machaggis. The sequel to Oh Mama. Snow just kept falling all weekend, making it feel more like February than Easter Sunday. Sure made falling down a lot more fun. {X50, as taken}
item.content:encoded:
16th Apr 06: Love the snow, originally uploaded by machaggis.

The sequel to Oh Mama. Snow just kept falling all weekend, making it feel more like February than Easter Sunday. Sure made falling down a lot more fun.
{X50, as taken}

item.title: 14th Apr 06: Late Arrival
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: 14th Apr 06: Late Arrival, originally uploaded by machaggis. Traffic at Everett. Mad rain south of Bellingham. A line at the border crossing at Aldergrove (almost unheard of). Snowblizzards on Highway 99. It was a little after midnight, but we were glad to make it to Whistler. {X50, as taken}
item.content:encoded:
14th Apr 06: Late Arrival, originally uploaded by machaggis.

Traffic at Everett. Mad rain south of Bellingham. A line at the border crossing at Aldergrove (almost unheard of). Snowblizzards on Highway 99. It was a little after midnight, but we were glad to make it to Whistler.
{X50, as taken}

item.title: Oh Mama
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: Back from Whistler, and catching up. The aphotoperday series is going to be very Whistler-oriented, so I apologise if it’s not your thing. But to get you into the mood, please watch this short video excerpt: Oh Mama.
item.content:encoded: Back from Whistler, and catching up. The aphotoperday series is going to be very Whistler-oriented, so I apologise if it’s not your thing. But to get you into the mood, please watch this short video excerpt: Oh Mama.

Radical graphics on my new snowboard – minty fresh, ready to go: 157.5 Lib Tech MC K2 Formula bindings Salomon Brigade boots Gotta love those sales at the end of the season even if I end up a brand mongrel (a photo of my beaten snowboard … Continue reading "12th Apr 06: Burning Heart"
item.content:encoded:
12th Apr 06: Burning Heart, originally uploaded by machaggis.

Radical graphics on my new snowboard – minty fresh, ready to go:

  • 157.5 Lib Tech MC
  • K2 Formula bindings
  • Salomon Brigade boots

Gotta love those sales at the end of the season even if I end up a brand mongrel (a photo of my beaten snowboard will follow someday I’m sure).
{D50, as taken}

item.title: 5″ of snow
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: I was lucky this weekend. My friend Jim called and invited us to go snowboarding. Danika couldn’t make it (off learning new sports) but I roped Morgan into joining us and we headed to Crystal yesterday. They had received 5″ of spring snow and it was pretty damn fine. Certainly better than gardening. We spent … Continue reading "5″ of snow"
item.content:encoded:
I was lucky this weekend. My friend Jim called and invited us to go snowboarding. Danika couldn’t make it (off learning new sports) but I roped Morgan into joining us and we headed to Crystal yesterday. They had received 5″ of spring snow and it was pretty damn fine. Certainly better than gardening. We spent an extra-ordinary amount of fun time in the Snorting Elk Bowl and also scooting about with Jim and Fidelma.

It’d rounded out a rather sporadic activity week nicely – I’ve had to change my work route due to the closed Elliot Bay Park, so lost a mile per day on the bike as the new route is more direct and less scenic.

Mon (3rd): nada (flying)
Tue: bike to work and have flat tire on way home
Wed: bike to/from work (coming home on Dexter)
Thu: bike to/from work
Fri: nada
Sat: nada
Sun: snowboarding at Crystal
